result.execSummary:
The defendant Shelby L Thelen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
Court authorized expungement under 973.015, upon successful completion of probation and complying with all conditions of probation.

Defendant must attend an anger management assessment and follow through with any recommendations. 

The defendant must attend and successfully complete a parenting class.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar typle meeting per week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shelby L Thelen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shelby L Thelen in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:32 AM. Called 16CM07 and 16CM25. State - resolved - 16CM07 - amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC - plead NC to count as amended, $500 forfeiture plus costs, plead G/NC to #2 as alleged and place on probation for 12 months with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, attend and successfully complete a parenting class, absolute sobriety, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bar or taverns, employment/school, 35 hours of community service, attend a self help meeting once a week; 16CM25 - plead NC to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, #2 - DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: count #1 - $300 plus costs and surcharges, count #3 - $100.00 fine plus costs and surcharges with other conditions as stated in 16CM07 except for an additional 200 hours of community service. Thelen and Joy agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #2 on 16CM25. Thelen pleads NC to counts #1 and #3. Court amends count #1 on 16CM07 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - 60 DTP/CO. Thelen pleads NC to count #2 as alleged on 16CM07. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing- follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for expungement. Thelen makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CM07 - count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 12 months with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, attend and successfully complete a parenting class, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 35 hours of community service, attend a community treatment program (AA/NA) once a week, costs - paid within 60 days/CO - not thru probation; 16CM25 - counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months, concurrent to 16CM07 and to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, attend and successfully complete a parenting class, absolute sobriety, no consumption of alconol and no entry into any bar or taverns, employment/school, 200 hours of community service - consecutive to 16CM07, attend a community treatment program (AA/NA) once a week, #1 - $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - take bond posted - remainder due within 60 days/CO - not thru probation, count #3 - $100.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO - not thru probation, submit DNA sample on each case with expunction right given, authorizes expungement under  973.015 on each case upon successful completion of probation and complying with all conditions of probation, right to appeal, adjourned.
Jury trial on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shelby L Thelen in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:40 PM. Joy - not resolved - has gone over Frye with the defendant and understands the implications from that. State - amend #1 to county ordianance with $500.00 fine plus costs and on count #2 - 1 year probation. Thelen understands. Court continues bond, set for JT. Also called 16CM25 that was set for INIT on 5/4/16. Joy has complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas and set for FPT. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT. Joy asks for reduction in bond to $500.00 cash. State - no objections. Court sets bond at $500.00 cash - no consumption of alcohol, refund remainder to defendant (poster agrees) and sets for FPT on same date and time.  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 20, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shelby L Thelen in court with attorney Jeffery Joy who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:53 AM. Thelen and Joy have complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts, set for FPT. State - bond - $450.00 cash that is already posted with no consumption of alcohol. Joy - bond - asks for signature bond for stated reasons. Court - $1000.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, refund bond posted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
